Belgia. 1591 pr
o
Junij To my L. Trea
s
Belgia: 1591: June:
May it please yo
r
good L. I receaved this daie her
Ma
t
l
re
wherof the date was omitted, w
th
2 from yo
r
L. of the 12 & 21
of May, in
e w
ch
I am required to deale w
th
e
States,
about
the abuse of theyr traffique, & w
th
e
Councel of State
, both in
that &
e matt
rs
of
Ostend,
as also w
th
oth
rs
in affaires of oth
r
qualitie, To
e g
na
l states w
ch
are heer remaining I
will resort at theyr first assembly. Howbeit the Councel of
State as I have form
r
ly written is de
ted hence, & resideth
at
Zutph
e
,
repairing daily to
e Campe as occasyons are p
nt
ed.
I had bin w
th
th
e
long ere this, as they have often required
by theyr l
re
s unto mee, but because
e g
na
ll states continew
still heere, & I had not heard from yo
r
L. since
e 9 of Aprill
for w
ch
I expected somewhat by
e first to be im
ted unto them,
I thought to attend
e receat of my next fr
o
yo
r
L.
since
e 9
of Aprill, for w
ch
I
And now what answere shall bee made
by
e States in
is place I will certifie from hence & de
te
immediately upon it to
e Councel of State, whose answere in like
manner I will p
nt
ly retourne, & for
e recovery of those
bookes & specialties w
ch
were brought out of Spaine, I have
alredy dispatched
M
r
Gilpin
toward
Amsterdam,
w
th
so
sufficient instruction as if they bee to bee had, yo
r
L. desire
shalbe thorowly accomplished. The opportunity of this bearer
doth cause mee to signify somewhat thus in g
na
l upon
the sighte of my l
re
s, The bearers name is
Chistopher
Kennet
an officer of
S
r
Thomas Sherly
: deputed for
e payment of
the Comp
ies
in field, &
e garrison of
Flushing,
&
Berghen,
& likewise for
e sending of mony to
e
Brill
& Ostende
In respect of his charge in these countreys I thought it not
im
tinent to name him to yo
r
L. & to certify w
th
all, that to
my und
r
standing & in
e common opinion of all, that looke
into his dealing, his diligence & discretion doth deserve
a better testimony, then I have p
nt
ly occasyon to yeeld in
his behalf, And altho I think S
r
Thomas Sherly hath some
cause of Importance to call him home for a time, yet for
avoyding inconvenience, if the troupes at
e campe be not
duly
vided, wh
r
in I am required by this Councel to use
all meanes of prevention, his speedy dispatch wilbee
greatly requesit. There is no oth
r
occurence since
e
writing of my Last
e 22 of May. This is onely expected
that o
r
forces being approched w
th
in half common shott of
e
walles of
Deventer,
we shall heare by
e first some good
fol.156v
[To my L.]
T
re
r June 1 1591
Belgia: 1591: June:
successe of
e batterye. The Ennemy wee learne doth
assemble all his forces in all quarters w
th
intent to remove
e
siege, to w
ch
effect as l
re
s report that come to this pla
ce
he hath fully appeased w
th
payment, the Mutins of
Die
st
&
Herentals,
& so for this p
nt
&c. 1 Junij.
